review:
Análise feita em 2024: jogo de luta decente no estilo anime. Segue o padrão de qualidade dos jogos publicados pela ArcSys. Possui uma boa variedade de personagens com seu próprio estilo de luta e bem balanceados em geral (embora poucos sejam memoráveis na questão "desenho"). O sistema de luta está parecido com o padrão "Street Fighter" da indústria, e os combos são fáceis de executar seguindo o padrão golpe fraco seguido de golpe forte. Gráficos em HD (um 1080p já faria uma boa diferença, mas quem joga de arte pixelada não vai achar ruim). A maioria dos cenários não são memoráveis, e não seguem o padrão de mundo proposto. Existe um modo arcade seguindo os padrões tradicionais: há uma apresentação inicial com as motivações do personagem que você escolheu, assim como uma apresentação final (ambas só imagens, textos e música de fundo... sem dublagem). A trilha sonora é boa (rock). O nível de dificuldade da CPU é um dos mais balanceados que eu já vi nos jogos da ArcSys (tirando o último chefe que em dificuldades acima da média fica quase, se não impossível).

Roda liso em sistemas Linux utilizando o SteamPlay (Proton 9.0).

review: A solid arcade port of an underrated hidden gem. Chaos Code is much akin to the Street Figther Alpha sub-series, but as a 4-button game with more "anime fighter" typical elements and a wilder cast of characters, such as Cthylla; magical girl wonder from beyond this world complete with her own theme song, and other creative character ideas. Developed by FK Digital, this arcade port includes a number of options such as a better-defined key binding system than simple emulation has, unlockable boss mode character variants, and even a "garden mode". The downsides of this, however, are the lack of rollback netcode and the command list not including a list of universal mechanics, forcing players to research on the Mizuumi Wiki or other services. A sequel, despite the creator's death, is in the works as well, which will hopefully address this game's shortcomings.

author: {'steamid': '76561198336124531', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 503, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 66, 'last_played': 1685226811}
review:
[h1] UM JOGÃO QUE NÃO MERECE SER PUNIDO POR UMA ÚNICA FALHA! [/h1]

***No momento em que escrevo esta resenha, eu tenho 50 horas de gameplay (Nintendo Switch) e 1 hora (Steam).

Alguma vez você já jogou um game despretensioso, que jamais foi designado para estar entre as estrelas da sua categoria, mas que foi forjado para ser simplesmente MUITO DIVERTIDO?

Entre os games de luta, um me veio a mente, imediatamente, ao jogar Chaos Code pela primeira vez: Waku Waku 7. Waku Waku 7 foi um game (da linhagem Galaxy Fight) criado para isto: para ser divertido. Não para ser o melhor. E o que podemos dizer? Ele foi muito bem sucedido neste quesito! Ele brilhou no que tinha que brilhar. Ninguém se lembra da sua lore, de um personagem sequer hoje em dia. Mas, quando você pensa naquele game, você tem lembranças positivas.

Neste estrito sentido, Chaos Code é provavalmente o Waku Waku 7 da Aksys!

[h1] O DNA DE CHAOS CODE [/h1]

O gameplay deste jogo o coloca na categoria de jogos de luta com as seguintes características:
- muito fácil de combar
- MUITOS golpes por personagem
- liberdade total
- equilíbrio entre golpes neutros e combos

É quase como se Garou: Mark of the Wolves namorasse Breakers Collection, e saísse um filho com o DNA da Aksys.

É uma DELÍCIA de jogar. Sério, nem parece que estamos falando de um remaster de um remaster de 2011.

[b]PONTOS POSITIVOS:[/b]

- A velocidade do game é perfeita. Você tem dash, pequenos dashs aéreos, corrida (como em the King of Fighters), diferentes pulos (como the king of fighters), esquiva (você fica invencível por alguns frames), e um Parry (visualmente falando, por muito tempo pensei que se tratava de um Roman Cancel, como em Guilty Gear, mas não, todo personagem tem um parry automático, que pode ser usado no chão ou no ar e é MUITO útil).

- Modos de jogo: online, survival, score attack, mission, versus, arcade, treinamento. Há também galeria (você precisa comprar). Há uma loja em que você compra coisas extras para os jogos, como versões de personagens, minigame, etc. Não há um modo story.

- A inteligência artificial é uma delícia! Até o nível 4 de dificuldade, você não terá problemas de vencer o modo arcade. Lá pela dificuldade, 6, 7 e 8...você terá MUITA diversão! Será um show de combos mirabolantes!

- Personagens super variados! Ainda que sejam poucos (16), eles são muito variados entre si. E, o que eu mais gostei, MUITOS golpes de uso inéditos! Sabe...às vezes o jogo de luta muda, e apesar de graficamente diferentes, os golpes servem para a mesma coisa. Neste game, há golpes muito originais! Eu gostei muito mesmo!

- As músicas fogem do que se está acostumado em games da Aksys. Aqui as músicas são mais descontraídas e menos Rock´n Roll. Mas se encaixou muito bem, são ótimas...lembra muito o som da SNK!

[b]CARACTERÍSTICAS ÚNICAS QUE VOCÊ SÓ VERÁ EM CHAOS CODE[/b]

Eu não queria usar a palavra "sandbox", mas vou usá-la como analogia. Este game é, sem sombra de dúvidas, o game com maior aspecto de liberdade em combos que eu já joguei. Acima eu falei que cada personagem tem um Parry automático, que eu erroneamente havia confundido como um Roman Cancel. 

Sabe porque este game não tem um botão de Roman Cancel (que lhe permite cancelar um golpe especial em um outro)? Porque, basicamente, é como se TODO GOLPE tivesse um Roman Cancel embutido. É sério. Você consegue combar de tudo que é jeito....você vai descobrir que cada personagem pode ter várias sequências entre botões de socos e chutes, seja em pé, no ar, durante dash, durante air dash....que causam efeitos diferentes e golpes diferentes. Se isto não bastasse para combar, cada personagem tem MUITOS golpes especiais (e suas versões EX, usando 2 socos ou 2 chutes e gastando parte da barra de especial)...que podem ser usados em diferentes situações. São muito versáteis mesmo! E você pode cancelar uma sequência de socos e chutes em especiais, especiais em super especiais (gastando uma barra). 

Você tem ainda um ultra especial de 3 barras, ou pode trocar as 3 barras por um modo anarquia!! Sim, anarquia, tipo: faça tudo o que você quiser e sempre sonhou sem consequências...faça golpes ilimitados, cancelamentos ilimitados, especiais e super ilimitados, e vai na fé..pois se você tem habilidade, você vai dar 30...40 hits antes mesmo de usar um ultra especial, de tanto que você vai kikar o adversário antes do tempo da barra esgotar rs  

Ou seja, tudo aquilo que você tinha dificuldade por não ser um mestre de The King of Fighters, que você vê os outros fazendo em torneios, você vai conseguir fazer em Chaos Code! 

Conheça BEM os personagens e use sua criatividade, que você vai conseguir usar os golpes deles nas mais diversas situações. LIBERDADE TOTAL.

Outra característica única deste game é que antes da batalha começar, você precisa escolher:
- 2 entre 4 golpes especiais bônus (podem ser golpes especiais ou super especiais também..)
- se prefere que seu personagem corra ou dê Dash.

Achei MUITO legal, seu personagem poder escolher mais golpes especiais para sua já grande quantidade de golpes. O personagem que eu mais gosto, eu escolho um golpe extra..que se desmembra em 8 (OITO!!) variações diferentes (é mole?)

[b]Mas, agora vem o motivo pelo qual o game não foi um sucesso...e que eu considero INJUSTO:[/b]

[h1]A FALHA ESTÁ AQUI:[/h1]

Você lê o nome "Chaos Code New Sign of Catastrophe" e você pensa: uau, deve ser uma lore riquíssima em temas pesados very crazy! NÃO! Porque não tem lore, não tem história. Não tem nada. O que tem são pequenos diálogos (pequenos mesmo). Não há modo história, praticamente não há contexto! A não ser que este game seja de um anime que eu desconheço (não assisto animes), o jogo não foi capaz de entregar a relação entre os personagens. Parece para mim um monte de personagens bizarros sem relação nenhuma, ali como pretexto pra fazer um game de luta.

EU NÃO LIGO PRA ISSO. Eu ligo pro gameplay delicinha de jogar, mas muitos precisam de um "personagem principal". Aqui não existe um Ryu e Ken, nem um Ky e Sol....e tudo é bem sem noção. O Zangief do jogo é um Cozinheiro fortão cujo pilão é te jogar na panela e fazer um caldo...aí você chega com ele na penultima chefe que é uma Robô pervertida e o chefe final é uma espécie de vampiro cheio de minions demônios. Não faz o menor sentido pra mim, mas ok....rs O personagem que parece ser o principal é um tarado que fica babando em toda personagem feminina que ele enfrenta kkk

Falando em último chefe...o esquema para vencê-lo é igual o da Marie (Skullgirls) e o  Beelzebub (Granblue Fantasy): não deixe ele se afastar. Para onde ele for, vá atrás feito um maníaco. Longe você será atingido em todos os ângulos por zilhoes de coisas diferentes, ininterruptamente rs

Enfim, os jogadores não se conectam com os personagens. Eu lembro mais do jogo em si e da diversão do que dos personagens em si. Como Waku Waku 7. rs

Este é o grande defeito do jogo. Não está no gameplay, gráficos, sons, modos de jogo nem na diversão. Está no contexto, nos personagens aparentemente desconexos e sem sentido. 

O design dos personagens também não são a cereja do bolo. São legais. Esteticamente as lutas são ÓTIMAS, mas não se trata daquele desenho penetrante, único, inesquecível. Problema semelhante que aconteceu com Kizuna Encounter...um game original, com gameplay fantástico, mas personagens esteticamente "meh". E aquele jogão também não vingou. Uma pena....

[h1]RECOMENDO MUITO!!![/h1]

Quer DI-VER-SÃO despretenciosa? Um game que tem um "Quê" de Garou nas animações e ritmo de luta, mas com todo o "crazy show" da Aksys e uma LIBERDADE TOTAL no desenvolvimento de estratégias, com lutas imprevisíveis até o final...e muitos dedos cansados? Compre este jogo! Ele é um dos games de luta "side business" mais divertidos que eu já joguei! Ele não é o melhor, não é o pior, mas ficará na memória como um daqueles jogos mais divertidos que você não tem nenhum amigo para jogar!!

I am a 51 year old father, probably one of the oldest people playing this game.
I am a single father to my son, who is now 14.
My son recently downloaded CHAOS CODE -NEW SIGN OF CATASTROPHE- and in less than a week,
he had already played for over 26 hours. This was terrible for me,
as it was already hard enough for me to spend time with my son,
as he is always out with his friends or just watching videos on Tiktok.
So I decided to make a Steam account and get this game to see if I could maybe play alongside him.
I loaded into the game, but I was stuck on what you where supposed to do.
I asked my Son for help and he hosted a game for me to join.
I loved it as it was the best time I had spent with my Son since my wife had died.
This game has ever since brought my son and I closer again and now we actually spend time together outside the house as well.
This game reminded me that there's fun to be had in everything,
and it has brought both me and my Son many happy memories.

author: {'steamid': '76561197992589486', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 60, 'playtime_forever': 1345, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 92, 'last_played': 1657484127}
review:
Chaos Code is a solid fighter and plays a lot like the more traditional fighters (with a dash of anime fighters playstyle and character designs). The unique aspect of the series is that you get to choose 2 extra special moves and dash/step for your character during selection as a form of customization. It uses the same 4-button layout as the KOF series with some similarities like using A+B for dodge roll. The controls in the game feel a bit floaty and needs getting used to if you are more accustomed to modern fighters, but the moves are very easy to pull off thanks to the generous input buffer, and combos are easy to connect. You can also juggle enemies while they are still airborne (if they don't tech), making it really fun to lab characters for combo strings. The game has nearly everything in terms of system mechanics, EX skills, air dashes, guard breaks and much more. I think players who liked KOF mechanics but found the various types of jumps too hard might really like the gameplay. 

Characters are quite varied in how they play and some of them have quite unconventional move sets. It also has some pretty weird and funny characters like Cait & Sith and especially Catherine, whom I won't say more except to borrow from Steins;Gate, "Delicate as an orchid, fair as a cherry blossom, the personification of feminine grace. But he's a guy.". It's hilarious that there are 2 separate missions where you have to fight all female and male cast respectively, and Catherine appears in both!

The game has a good amount of single player content, having Arcade, Versus, Mission, Practice, Score Attack and Survival modes. Mission mode is not combo trials, but rather a set of fights that you need to win under certain conditions - a lot of them are puzzle-like in nature that requires experimentation. There's also a Collection mode which has a gallery and some game-impacting unlockables beyond extra color palettes, like a mini-game, additional game options and boss versions of the characters (like the unlimited versions in BlazBlue series). A noteworthy unlockable is "Chaos mode" which allows you to use your character with all extra moves (instead of having to choose) but deal 20% less damage. Stuff in Collection mode are unlocked using in-game currency which can be earned via all of the game modes (even Practice). There's even a custom color editor which is enhanced further with unlockable colors. It has a surprisingly good soundtrack that is varied across genres which I really like - a special mention here is Cthylla's theme. It's a shame that the game doesn't have a tutorial mode, but the mechanics can be easily found online.

On the technical aspects of the game, it performs pretty well at my end with no crashes thus far. I did initially get an error when I was configuring the display settings where I made a whole lot of changes and apply them at once. But when I apply changes one by one, everything worked just fine. Some might find the graphics to be blurry at 1080p, although I think they look fine to me as I'd rather not see the jagged pixel outlines. Also, a nice touch is that the images with move lists at each side of the screen can be removed by selecting "Widescreen" instead of "Original". However, the space of battleground is still the same and so, the characters will not be at the edges of the screen.

In terms of the negatives, I don't have any in terms of the gameplay. The game's UI, however, does have its annoyances. The important one for me would be that recording/playback in Training mode cannot be bound to a single button, and requires that you first hold Start and then hit LB to switch between recording and playback. After choosing either mode, you then have to hold Start and then hit RB to start recording/playing. Another is that whenever you exit training mode, it resets the dummy settings. Also, if you change your button bindings, it also changes the controls with the UI - and this isn't reflected in the UI itself. During character selection, here's also no way to cancel the last action if you change your mind since all buttons are confirm buttons with color selection tied to them, and there's quite a few selections to go through.

Overall, Chaos Code -New Sign of Catastrophe- is a very good package for players who like the more traditional fighters and want more single player content. As one myself, I enjoyed the game and I'm hoping that the newer Chaos Code Next will come to Steam. I highly recommend getting this when it's on sale, but after spending more time with it, I think even its asking price is fair imo. If there's any fighting game on Steam that deserves to be called a "hidden gem", this one is really it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198318179036', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 25, 'playtime_forever': 946, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 276, 'last_played': 1660221732}
review:
Is the online as good as dead? Yeah. But god it's such fun to play. Gameplay-wise, it plays like a mix of King of Fighters and anime air-dashers like Guilty Gear/BlazBlue, while also adding some of its own mechanics.

It uses King of Fighters' 4 button model, with light and heavy punches and kicks and it uses their general combo structure. It then spices that up with airdasher-esque canceling, like dash cancels and jump cancels. It also borrows double-jumps and air-dashes from the air-dasher genre, making the movement nice and mobile. The characters also feel very unique in a way that I've only found in Guilty Gear or BlazBlue. Characters are given abilities that make them fundamentally different from all other fighters, rather than different only by minute differences in frame data or hitboxes.

It then tosses in its own mechanics, that being the character skill customizations. In addition to your standard moveset, you are allowed to choose 2 of 4 additional moves and to choose between either having a run or a hop as your "double-tap forward". I suppose you could draw parallels to the V-Skill in SFV, but the selectable moves in Chaos Code feel far more integral to the characters' playstyles.

Overall, very fun. Worth every penny, and, if you wait for a sale, you can find it absurdly cheap. If you can get some friends to play with, all the better.

[h1]<混沌代码：新生浩劫>玩了19个小时勉强看完全剧情···

非常棒的2D格斗游戏，而且还有官中！各种CG都超好看的呢！

操作很简单，基本都是左摇杆一直转圈圈，顺时针还是逆时针凭感觉，右边一通乱按，大招什么的都随缘出，2333

游戏剧情主要集中在街机模式，选择任意角色一路冲到底（大概一个角色8场战斗）就能看到各个角色的剧情和结局。并获得混沌点数来解锁各类收藏品。

游戏大部分成就集中在解锁和任务模式！
[spoiler]···可惜我的CE技术不行找不到地址··· [/spoiler]
任务模式一共35+SP16个任务···别以为一个任务是一场一场的格斗，有的任务可是要打好多场（比如和所有女角色冲冲冲，或者和所有男角色冲冲冲···）
生存模式一共30场战斗···任意一个角色完成解锁一个成就
分数模式一共16场战斗···任意一个角色完成解锁一个成就
对战模式任选角色冲一把···
完成后获得混沌点数来解锁收藏品。

网络模式我就不看了，看上去是鬼了，不过至少有排行榜~

我这种剧情党主要还是玩街机模式解锁剧情。

角色剧情流水账：
[spoiler] 
[h1]通用剧情[/h1]
大多数格斗游戏的剧情都会重复某些套路，这游戏也不例外，基本每个角色都要经过一些战斗冲冲冲。
直到一定程度后找到了西莉亚2式，作为混沌代码的守护者要消灭所有接近混沌代码的人···
消灭西莉亚2式后面对想要将混沌代码据为己有的古德拉克·艾玛···
（如果玩家扮演古德拉克·艾玛则是防御设施复制了一个古德拉克···）
剧情会有细节差异，但最后2场都固定。

[h1]光[/h1]
正义感十足的光以帮助贫民维护世界和平而加入地球联合军作为少尉特务，并得到密令抹除反地球组织密探“篝”然后确保混沌代码。
最后混沌代码和敌人逃了，而联合军将围住设施，接手光的后续任务，并被大佐嘲讽了一番。
A结局：
原来联合军即使没有混沌代码也无所谓，设施内的资料也能强化他们的军备，联合军不过为了胜利将违逆他们的人全部消灭，最后才算”和平“，而光在这次任务中吸引了红集的注意，干扰了篝让联合军搜索进度顺利。
之后心情不好的光庆幸混沌代码没被联合军取得，但要是自己能先获取混沌代码呢？？一下子又斗志满满···
B结局：
带回混沌代码的光即将升为中尉，大佐的想法是在还有利用价值的情况下继续让其卖命。之后就是和露比娜斯的欢乐互动。可惜光为了手办而忽略了对方···

[h1]篝[/h1]
童年双亲被地球联合介入的纷争中过世而痛恨联合政府的篝被红集的首领红收养后作为反地球联合组织红集的密探，为了复仇而投身战火。
A结局：
完成任务后放下战士的身份回到少女模样看烟花，结果任务来了···她又要开始新任务了···
B结局：
没获得混沌代码目标也更丢了过于丢脸，不过红觉得反正也获得了很多情报没有过多责备且不希望对方受伤！实际情况确是篝的身体大概率是红的下一副躯体···

[h1]赛伯拉斯[/h1]
宝藏猎人赛伯拉斯为了寻找代替自己惨遭诅咒的伙伴而寻找解除诅咒的办法，无意间听到混沌代码似乎能解除诅咒而冲冲冲。
A结局：
获得混沌代码后将好友彼得恢复，然后他们继续冒险。
B结局：
救下彼特的赛伯拉斯和彼特分开了，但他们还是宝物猎人，迟早回再见面的···之后他和艾姬多娜一起继续探险···

[h1]古德拉克[/h1]
因科技兴起而没落的魔术世家后代古德拉克在科学上注入魔术来让世界陷入混沌。
A结局：
战斗过程中最后面对古德拉克的剧情稍微有点差别，防御系统复制了一个古德拉克与其战斗，而不是其他角色的召唤，但基本也差异不大。
最后在研究所迷路了，然后面对西莉亚2·改，打败后又要面对更恐怖的防御西莉亚改改改···
B结局：
混沌能量的基础理论就是平行世界的钥匙，他父亲因此扑街，而古德拉克准备继续父亲的研究···

[h1]西莉亚[/h1]
喜欢萝莉打扮的普通女高中少女，实际确实开发出混沌能源的特斯拉博士制作的人造人（就是人型女高达！！），为了寻找失踪的特斯拉博士而追查混沌代码，然后一直和其他角色对战冲冲冲···
结局A：
最后终于找到了失踪的特斯拉博士（父亲）来完成自己想变成人类的愿望！不过他们都知晓这是不可能的，于是打算变成究极人造人（高达GP03那种···），然后和博士一起生活守护混沌代码。
结局B：
没找到父亲的西莉亚带着西莉亚II的头，然后继续上学寻找父亲（博士）

该角色可是裙子里藏着各种飞弹，可爱玩偶炸弹浮游炮等等，
很多招式都和高达很像，比如：天使羽翼就像飞鸟的命运高达的翅膀；电刃漫步不就是光束刀咩；恶作剧之鞭、喷射攻击等等都很像···

[h1]梵恩[/h1]
曾和姐姐约定会守护好自己却在地球联合政府纷争中沦为孤儿的梵恩，而被姐姐抛弃的想法侵蚀了他开始毁灭世界。
A结局：
打败古德拉克结果却没找到混沌代码，而联合军也找了进来，这时候姐姐篝出现叫着他的名字“真”带着他逃离。
接下来他要继续找混沌代码和古德拉克，篝想恢复过去姐弟情却被拒绝了···他是梵恩，堕入血之炼狱的梵恩···
B结局：
梵恩受重伤时的梦里梦见姐姐了，谜之人从他那嗅到了什么，觉得他能帮其看到他想要的终点···

这个角色的剑真好用！

[h1]西莉亚II·改[/h1]
在混沌代码事件后被毁的西莉亚II被回收修复改良后成了西莉亚II·改，得知博士挂念研究室留下的信息可能会被利用而回研究室打算破坏资料。
A结局：
进入研究室正常剧情的西莉亚II变成量产型西莉亚，然后面对迷路的古德拉克！
最终破坏并回收资料后将量产型西莉亚的头部带回去给博士，变成了西莉亚III，之后她们3人继续回收又取回了新的头···姐妹们变多了！！
B结局：
西莉亚II·改没解决古德拉克，却被称呼古德拉克为儿子的探测不到生命反应的谜之人从背后攻击···最后只剩下头···

[h1]爱尔美丝[/h1]
千金大小姐爱尔美丝在书房的魔导书中召唤出精灵后就离家出走以主播身份活着，同时还是反地球联合组织红集的佣兵并接受追踪混沌代码的任务。
结局A：
当她获得混沌代码后叛变组织消灭下忍后带着混沌代码离开了···
结局B：
面对红派出的各个忍者，爱尔美丝从容应对，红很生气，不过日子还长着呢···
这个角色会放闪电！

[h1]香取平八[/h1]
香取平八是行为就和女性一样的少女漫画家获得了不可思议的力量和怪力并自称凯瑟琳。以寻找灵感为由开始对混沌代码进行调查。
A结局：
最后漫画是古德拉克退场，赛伯拉斯和凯瑟琳Happy End~不过下个月可能···
B结局：
凯瑟琳获得灵感并加入剧本觉得很棒，可惜编辑却因为上头的原因导致原稿不能用···
这估计就是传说中的黑钛+变身！

[h1]寇帝拉[/h1]
异世界魔法少女寇帝拉享受着恶作剧的快感，然后听到了混沌代码的流言而展开调查。
A结局：
最后古德拉克打不过寇帝拉于是让混沌代码失控，为此寇帝拉用魔法让其稳定下来！救下这个世界的寇帝拉觉得整个世界都是她的游乐场，古德拉克也成了奴隶···虽然最后混沌代码没get到···
B结局：
获得混沌代码后从古德拉克那得知那只是碎片，于是···她又有新玩具了，于是打算带着古德拉克继续寻找其他碎片···

[h1]布拉伯[/h1]
义式料理主厨突然对中华料理很有兴趣，于是成了义中两种口味的主厨！结果店铺卷入客人间的纷争破产，为获得混沌代码的巨额奖金来开新店而战斗！
A结局：
成功获得奖金并开了新店，却因为义式料理的师傅让其回意大利而战斗···再这么下去新店估计也要扑街了···
B结局：
料理擂台冠军布拉伯诞生···
这角色战斗风格就像炒菜，各种锅碗瓢盆和料理！

[h1]凯特/希[/h1]
凯特/希这对兄妹的父亲被诅咒成帽子了！为了让其恢复原状一直追踪着当时和父亲一起的人赛伯拉斯。
A结局：
和赛伯拉斯的结局差不多，不过赛伯拉斯变成父亲和孩子们而已。
父亲彼特恢复后，他们一家出去探险。
整个游戏里唯一一个两人上台战斗的角色！她们关系真好！
凯特被打倒对手居然不会成热打铁攻击希！！！而是让希回凯特那····
B结局：
没找到混沌代码的兄妹最终和赛伯拉斯一起当宝藏猎人，直到多年后有一次听说有个宝藏能解开世间所有诅咒！

这对角色战斗就像双人花样滑冰。

[h1]露伊[/h1]
因为讨厌乡下而去都市，但内心却依旧喜欢故乡。然后展开佛像夺回作战？
所以神像和混沌代码有啥关系！？Emmm
A结局：
夺回神像回到村子，村子变城市，村长也变市长了！
市长看到露伊把代表保守的的代代相传的神像带回来，看到那混沌的造型和不愉快的气息，他好不容易让保守派舍弃旧的习俗让其变成如城市一样繁荣！可不能让神像再回来开倒车！于是让露伊赶紧滚···
B结局：
被村长赶走的露伊很快被特警入侵，结果把特警打跑了···emmm···
这结局好滑稽···

[h1]雷伊[/h1]
雷伊感觉事件背后有黑幕毅然辞去军警职务靠着赌场打手讨生活并追查真相！
A结局：
打败古德拉克后被前警察厅长截住，过去的警察生涯一半都在帮雷伊搽屁股，接下来由他们接手追查，并任命雷伊为这个事件的特别搜查队队长，反正雷伊的行动都被他们监视着，不如光明正大地拿来利用···一个月后果然抓到了某些幕后议长和议员···
B结局：
拒绝军方邀请的雷伊现在只能拍电影了，结果片场被小混混打扰！于是···雷伊又有活了···

[h1]露比娜斯[/h1]
地球联合军的露比娜斯童年因战争牵连导致失去左手并锁上心扉，直到遇到光才满满敞开心扉。但上级却给了个监视光的任务···对光少尉的尊敬和军队的忠诚在她心中冲突着。
A结局：
最后对战古德拉克铁壁扑街了，对方带着混沌代码逃离了，大佐很快带部队到达并接手设施，反正设施里的资料对我军也很有帮助，放假后露比娜斯就拉着光约会去了···
B结局：
露比娜斯抓住了古德拉克，这时候古德拉克以修复手臂为诱惑却没成功！于是诱惑丰胸！结果成功逃了···emmm···怨念···

 [/spoiler]

剧情是多线独立的，每个角色剧情都有所联系又有一定冲突！
每个角色都有AB两个结局，我只打出A结局，B结局要花点数解锁。B结局应该是能不能直接打出来···

其实有些B结局其实是A结局的延续，但很多B结局又和A结局冲突···emmmm···

author: {'steamid': '76561198005591343', 'num_games_owned': 342, 'num_reviews': 45, 'playtime_forever': 2889, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2775, 'last_played': 1678712011}
review:
First the good things.
Custom colors! Each character can select from 10 colors for each part (hair, skin, clothing 1-3). Default palettes are also nice and often a reference to characters from other IPs.

The game has really nice stages, probably one of the prettiest I've encountered in games. There's almost always something happening in the background, though without stealing away your focus with sounds or flashy colors.

Character designs are mosty good, though few (like Cait & Sith or Ray are either boring or too cliche). Cthylia wins here no doubt. You also don't see a chef character that literally cooks his opponent to death that often.

Voice acting sounds proper too - voices match their characters and are delivered with proper emotions.

There are some really funny moments lore-wise for most of the characters and I will genuinely miss some of them after I'm done with Chaos Code.
 
Gameplay wise the game is really fun and fluid with just the right amount of input leniency. Sadly, I can't comment on proper versur play since I've never seen anyone playing it online (and I couldn't be bothered to look up discord or anything since there are other FGs I want to play too).

Music is really good, though it's unfortunate that each track is tied to specific stage.

THE BAD.
Game wastes too much time with unnecessarily long animations and transitions. I'm pretty sure they are hardcoded to play fully, thus making no use of SSD and fast RAM. Either that or it's poorly optimized for loading times. Selecting character is also annoying since you have to also choose 2 extra skills and movement type, so that's extra few clicks every time, with no way to save a preset combinations.

Writing. The overall story and all that "Chaos Code" McGuffin is clichey and cringy to the limits, as are many character lines (especially Kudlak's). You know, stuff like "my sister abandoned me, I will now destroy the world", "I'm the only person fit to use Chaos Code and rule the world", "Chaos Code is source of infinite energy that could destroy whole universe", etc.
But my biggest gripe with this game is with it's offline content besides Arcade mode: missions are not fun. They are also not truly challenging. Most have simple solution (2A -> 2B -> 2D) and are not hard, just tedious and frustrating with cheats reaching Shao Kahn level or more (stuff like invincible supers on 1F on wakeup with infinite meter or that BS Kudlak zoning that not even Satan could approve of).
Oh, also training mode is quite lacking - settings are reset each time you exit the mode, n

SUMMARY.
Since almost no one plays this game here on Steam anymore and due to how frustrating offline content is in most part, I can't recommend this game.
If you do have someone to play with or just want to look at pretty stages with great BGMs, then sure, buy it on sale. Not worth buying it just for achievements though.

Supposedly the sequel is continued after all, so hopefully most of my gripes with this game will be fixed (sluggish menu animations and slow transitions, terrible challenge mode, bad writing).

review:
A fighter that I really wish more people knew about and played.

To me it feels kinda like a mix of anime fighters and KoF, but really it's its own thing. 

There's a solid variety of characters to choose from, and better yet as part of your character selection you pick 2 addition special moves and if your character has a running dash or a forward hop. These choices and sometimes have a big impact on gameplan or combos, but not enough to be like picking a completely different character.

I also love the movelists in this game as they are some of the best layed out ones I've seen in a figher. A good example is Ray's stance moves which is not displayed as a list but as a clear diagram to show the moves can chain into other moves. 

The only bad thing about this game is the netcode is only delay based, and with the low number of people playing it you'll be hard pressed to ever find an online match.

review:
IMPORTANT NOTE: To run this game on Windows 10/11, you need Visual C++ redistributable 2013 (Install both the x86 and x64 versions). Then run this game in administrator mode. Otherwise, it will crash.

This game reminds me a lot of the old KOF games. Got it on sale for 4€, I don't regret it. It's fun. The fighting mechanics are pretty basic. Regular low to high attacks, special moves, super moves (chaos moves) which takes 1 power bar, and the 3 power bar attack that deals like half of your opponent's health in one single blow. But you can customize it a bit for your character too by selecting the dash movement and some special attacks that you can use during your battle (these attacks are unique for each fighter). This is good because it can make a difference between matches if you are losing, as a surprise factor, or if you need a new tactic against your opponent.

If that's not enough, you can unlock (with the in-game currency) a boss mode for each character so you can troll your friends.

If you like fighting games like KOF or Capcom Vs SNK, you are going to like this game. If you can get it cheap, give it a try.

author: {'steamid': '76561198028075955', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 1232, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1009, 'last_played': 1630894983}
review:
I bought this game repeatedly on ps3 ps4, now pc, and I've bought it for several friends whenever I can to play with them online.

This may be Published by Arc System, but it's not developed by it as some people may have some misconception, I guess I'm making this review because this page could use more positive reviews.  

This game may come off weird for a lot of arksystem anime fighters from all franchise like blazblue, GG, arcana hearts, undernight.  But more familiar to those like i said; Kof fans, capcom vs snk "1" or MVC2 combos fans.

It's a 4 button fighter layout, NO NOT 4 button like Blazblue or guilty gear (light, medium, heavy or A,B, C).  More akin to King of fighters button layout.  But the ease to  combo gatling/revolver is set more like MVC2 (without assist) or MVC-Infinite without tag/team focus (Review on that later, despite reception, its gameplay is fun). 
Maybe with exception of guilty gears revolver combos if you had set GG button layout to default, than it's basic universal combo is exact order of input.
2 Punchs (Light & Heavy Punch) and 2 Kick (Light # Heavy) you just simply input L.P>LK>HP>HK into a special/super of your choosing.

Perform Ex-special moves variations by pressing the different punch or kick simultaneously and fun experiment you can extend combos or just combo-ender for big damage payoff. (street fighter's 3-5 EX-special moves, set-up)

There's a button input for pressing LP+LK you do ONLY forward roll, where you can go past projectiles/opponent to get past zoning or just get get out of corners. (King of fighter mechanics)

The cool part of the games is the choices and customization after picking your character, they have a default special/super move set that comes with them upon selected, then it'll give you your choice of choosing 2 MORE addition options "choose do want 2 special moves add-on or more 2 Super Moves options, or 1 special and 1 super to compensate your character attack options?"

(Every character has different special options to given command grabs, projectile, teleport, drop-traps according to their archetype fighter.)

But that's not all, 2nd choice given to you they weirdly give your called character "movement/dash" option "Select your Bounce":  (Everyone can air dash equally)

Full running: most tradition anime fighters dash (some some weird character they'll auto-air  dash/jump, think like Ino (Guilty Gear) or Izayoi in (Blazblue) Drive-form)

Short-quick dash: you can actually cancel your 4 four button standing normal attacks into the dash input for messing with your opponent and keep pressuring.

If you're OPEN to trying different 2d fighters, you've got, add it to your belt of collections as a jack-of-all-trader Fighting gamer.

Downside or common negatives I'll admit: 

No tutorial - Yeah i'll agree, this game is tough without explanation, but like any other anime fighters beside new recent ones with great guide, this game is fun to lab if you PLAYED enough capcom/snk games to get general universal combo/mechanics idea it'll unfortunantely assume you have some experience with all of them, but the game devs certainly takes inspiration from what i've already described already.

Character designs i feel may seem uninspiring on surface ill admit, but when you play as them, they actually have a lot of personality in their attacks they throw out like most anime fighters, there's something for someone.  

Music is rad, i'd recommend "Cerberus theme -Chaos Code" for a sample on youtube.  training to that song when practicing sets the groove.

It's a dead game, but to me it's an easy game to pick and play if YOU the fighting players scrolling in reviews for something refreshing with friends to play with should gives this a shot.

review:
[h1]游戏关键词[/h1]

[b][u]动作[/u][/b] [b][u]对战[/u][/b] [b][u]多模式[/u][/b] [b][u]骚操作[/u][/b] [b][u]美漫画风[/u][/b] [b][u]多模式[/u][/b] [b][u]多玩法[/u][/b]

[h1]序引[/h1]

《CHAOS CODE -NEW SIGN OF CATASTROPHE-》，中文名《混沌代码：新生浩劫》，这是台湾团队福克科技F K Digital研发的一款动作决斗类游戏，游戏的玩法有点像以往拳皇决斗类游戏，该描述了各方势力围绕失踪科学家遗留下来的线索发生的一系列的争夺战。数量众多的角色与各类可选的必杀技的组合都提升了游戏的自由度和可玩性，另外游戏的画面的战斗细节上的刻画也十分细腻，玩家可以看到轻重拳腿连击下的爆炸特效，看起来十分带感~

 [h1]优缺点[/h1]

[b]🔶[u]优点：[/u][/b]

📈 美漫像素画风的画面 

📈 贴心的对战技能提示

📈 澎拜的战斗打击特效

📈 数量众多的人物角色

📈 多种不同模式玩法

[b]🔶[u]缺点：[/u][/b]

📉 菜单中文翻译不全

📉 背景配音较平淡

[h1]推荐人群[/h1]

游戏中多角色加技能的组合玩法的自由度十分不错，推荐给喜欢横板决斗类游戏的小伙伴，另外游戏在打折时的价格较优惠，建议喜欢的小伙伴打折入手玩耍~

[quote]
独乐乐不如众乐乐，如果我的评测让你感觉有帮助，请点个赞，让更多人看见，想了解更详细游戏内容，来，我们继续往下走~
[/quote]

[h1]游戏概况[/h1]

[b] 🔶 [u]游戏背景：[/u][/b]

游戏主要讲述了人类文明发展至极致并向字宙殖民的过程中、某科学家颠覆常识开发出一种崭新的能源，它能克服至今为止其他能源的缺点，因此该能源得到了快速的发展，但就在此时，该科学家却离奇失踪并留下了关键线索，上层想掩盖改事件却被媒体大幅度报道，各方势力将会围绕着该线索发生一系列的争夺战~

[b] 🔶 [u]游戏玩法：[/u][/b]

游戏在刚刚开始默认为英文，可自行在菜单选项OPTION中选择SYSTEM OPTION来把系统语言改为CH即可，游戏中有许多不同的战斗对抗模式，比如街机模式中可以体验到各个角色的剧情、生存模式中可以以一定的体力值调整不能的角色，这个对玩家的操作要求挺高的、任务模式可以挑战各种特殊条件下的高难度战斗、练习模式可以让玩家练习各个角色的操作以及必杀技、分数挑战模式是与电脑对战，可以挑战自身的极限，还可以把挑战的分数上传到排行榜、网络对战模式可以与电脑或其他玩家对战，不过遗憾的是，网络对战的人是比较少的，因此无法得知在对战中网络延迟等体验问题，

https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=2107573628
游戏支持键盘以及xbox360手柄操作，背景音乐没啥特色，节奏感较杂乱，在游戏菜单中，还可以看到许多优秀角色的立绘已经故事，游戏中可选的人物有十五个，玩家在选择人物界面选择人物后，还可在四种不同必杀技中选择二种来搭配使用，这给我一种DIY的感觉，通过不同人物不同必杀技的搭配选择，可以产生许许多多不同的角色玩法，游戏中每个人物
都有其对应背景介绍，剧情模式中，胜利后都有角色个人宣言~

https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=2107573586
游戏的玩法和以往的决斗类游戏差别不多，同样是采取三局二胜制，在游戏中，每个角色都有一个体力条，游戏的失败判断的唯一标准是：谁的角色体力值先为零或99秒倒计时结束后谁的角色体力值较少，当然也有一个非常特殊的情况，那就是双方的体力值同时为零或倒计时结束后双方体力相同，在这种情况下可视为平局，在战斗对抗过程中，游戏在对战过程中，细心地在画面两侧显示当前角色的各种技能，因此玩家可以根据屏幕左边的技能按键提示来释放相应的技能，游戏还有一个有趣的设定，当某角色短时间内被攻击过多，角色自身的气绝值就会上升，然后角色就无法动弹，通过使用这个设定，玩家可以在短时间内输出大量伤害并把对手打得不能动弹~

review:
It's a half decent fighting game with a lot of polish everywhere except in the sprite work. Which is bad, because the meat of the game(fighting) is carried by the battling sprites. A lot of the animations don't read well enough for me to well process what's going on. That's where a lot of character "charm" comes from, and characters are what make me care about returning to any series. Guilty Gear is Bullshit Crazy, but I can read everything that happens because of expertly crafted keyframes in the animations; in Chaos Code, I can't because everything is so awkward. This bleeds into the mechanics of the game as well - not having a clear understanding of the way my moves look is irrevocably tied to how well I understand the character. This might just be a me problem, though.
 
Everything in the game looks razor sharp except for the sprites of the people, both the players and the background fodder. Because of that, it's a bit jarring. A little polish, namely on the anatomy of the characters, and the keyframing, and you've got yourself a solid fighter. 

Oh, I don't recommend it for non-otaku. This game thrives on otaku culture, and you simply won't get it if you're not one.

review:
格ゲー歴約30年、大好きだけど未だにド下手なオッサンのレビューです。
ちゃんとした格ゲーとしての評価は、他の方のレビューをご覧ください。
【オススメポイント】
・背景が可愛い！
・音楽がカッコいい！
・女の子キャラが可愛い（声も良い）！野郎キャラもカワ・・・カッコいい！
・ラウンド開始時の掛け合いの種類が豊富。固有の組み合わせも結構ある。
・キャンセルの受付猶予がガバガバなので、必殺技→超必殺技が楽につながる！爽快！
総じて『格闘ゲームは苦手だけど好き』『やったこと無いけど、興味が有る』という方でも入りやすい、いい意味でユルい格ゲー。
キャラも個性的かつルックス抜群なので、システムを覚えなくても動かしているだけで楽しい。
キャラのイラストが好みで、実際のプレイ動画を見て楽しそうと思えるなら、手を出しても良いと思います。

【勧めにくいポイント】
・イメージ画像がシリアスで、実際シリアスな世界観ですが、突っ込みどころしか無い仕上がりになってます。
　狙って滑りまくっているポイントも多々あります。
　そういう点に憤りを感じる方は、多分、終始憤りっぱなしでしょう。勧めません。
・ドット粗目のキャラグラフィックが嫌いな人は、合わないかもしれません。
　（でも、決して悪くないので、まずはプレイ動画等を見て好みに合うか確認してみよう）
・殺伐としてない。火力高めなので、「大斬り一発」みたいな。瞬殺されても「アチャー！やられちゃったよ！」みたいな。
　事故っても笑って済む、みたいな。
　そういう手触りがイヤな人は、合わないかもしれません。

レビューは以上です。以下は感想です。
一言で言うと『超ハイクオリティな00年代の同人格ゲー』です。遊んでて楽しい良作です。
パロディ要素の強いキャラばかりですが、かなり上手く噛み砕き・飲み込んでおり、赤面することもありません。
研究して良し、適当なコンボをCPUに叩き込んでストレス解消しても良し。あなたのライブラリの片隅に、ぜひどうぞ。
私は買って良かったと思いました。（セールで、ですが）

review:
NESiCA1時代を盛り上げた亜ゲー。

格闘ゲームの中でもコンボゲーに部類される。
海外のゲームであるが、国内品と比べても見劣りはしないクオリティである。
会社はオーストラリアにあるが、開発は台湾人ということでアジアつまり亜ゲーに分類されている。

コンボゲーとしては目押しではなく先行入力がバリバリかかるタイプで爽快感があり、上級者の戦いになるとゲージ状態によっては死ぬまで持っていかれることもある。
海外ゲームであるが、それゆえか、いろんなアニメネタが散りばめられている。

そしてキャラも奇人変人ばかりでクセが強くゲーム全体としても濃いイメージ。
とにもかくにも普通のゲームじゃ物足りないという日本の格闘ゲーマーにも熱狂的なファンを生み出したゲームである。

author: {'steamid': '76561198166885149', 'num_games_owned': 331, 'num_reviews': 274, 'playtime_forever': 741, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 60, 'last_played': 1644669977}
review:
虽然手绘看上去比较古旧，还是堪称国产最强格斗游戏，论系统和手感能达到当年形意拳的水准。

除了COMBE系格斗游戏的标准系统，比较特别的一些设定：普通技不能跳取消但可以高跳取消，有类似GGXX系列的取消系统但是仅限用于超必杀，并且保留惯性。满气后可爆BC时限内可随意使用超杀。

每个人在战前可以像街霸3、街霸4一样在四种技能（两种必杀技两种超必杀技）中任选两种，另外可以选择冲刺的种类为滑步或者持续前冲。真研究起来变化还挺多的。

最大的缺点是读盘太慢。任务模式简直是解谜模式。必须知道打法才能过，另外附带一个有点像连连看的智力小游戏。据说要出加强版加两个新人，不过龟速。

建议打折入，最低时不到20。

review: This is honestly one of my favorite fighting games. If there's any game I'd say it's similar to, probably KOF or other SNK games, but it has a lot that makes it different obviously. It has great system and character balance with no one mechanic seeming overwhelming, and each character has their fair share of pros and cons that they have to work around with all of them still being on an even playing field, and especially with the extra selectable moves, this game properly avoids falling into the problem of some match ups feeling WAY too one sided, with every character having a good amount of variety to their move set without everyone being too similar. Fun character designs with cthulhu magical girls, muscly grappler chefs, edgelords and of course, my big boy Ray. There's so much freedom to every character with combos and tech, especially with the extra selectable specials and supers. I spend many hours in training mode trying to find new tech. Matches can vary a lot in how they play out based on what hits you land, so there's room for you to end a match in two combos (or even one in rare situations), but other matches will carry on much longer if you don't get your harder to land combo starters and counter hits or manage your resources towards big damage, and some characters often rely on meter to help them in neutral play and set ups. I really like that there's room for those kind of big combos to happen while also having it be very nuanced in how it's approached so that you don't just do the same stuff each match. Neutral plays just as big a role as learning big combos. Some characters can annihilate you through solid neutral alone if you can't adapt, so you gotta be strong on multiple fronts. There's many strong offensive and defensive mechanics with neither being overwhelming. No comeback mechanics or combo breakers (I personally hate that stuff). Meter is handled super well in terms of how much importance it holds and how each character interacts with it in their own way. Adds a nice bit of weight to resource management while still not being the only thing that determines who wins. I'm just kinda gushing, but god I love this game. A bit of a smaller player base, but we're still here and we're growing over time. Especially on discord. If you want to play this game, join Tenryo's discord server and there's plenty of people there to answer your questions and play you in matches, including myself. So yeah. Big glowing recommendation for this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198218345837', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 677, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 453, 'last_played': 1701265975}
review:
ネシカでプレイして気に入ったので買ったのですが、ほどほどに良いです。

◯評価点
・基本がしっかりしている
　操作系はスタンダードでわかりやすく、反応も良い。思ったとおりに動かせる。地味ですが大切な点です。

・組み合わせの妙
　追加必殺技と追加超必殺技を２種ずつから２コ選ぶのですが、このチョイスでかなり変わります。同じキャラでも変わった動きになるのは良いですね。

・日本ナイズなキャラクター
　見た目通り日本向なキャラで、ひねりもなく素直に楽しめます。

◯不満点
・カラーパレットの少なさとセンスの無さ
　パーツ分けは粗方決められており、髪と瞳がセットなどになっています。そして１０色から選ぶのですが…
　そう１０色しかないのです。赤青黃緑白黒でもう６色。
　ルイのニーハイが素肌にできたりなど、部分では良いチョイスもあるのですが、何分少なすぎてデフォルトカラーの８パターンを再現できないほどの酷さ。また白でも何故か違う白だったりする。肌の色で水色とか紫とか誰得？な意味不明チョイスが多々。それよりピンクっぽい白とか入れて。
　組み合わせも多くはできず、個性が出しにくい。この辺りは是非とも改善いただきたい。

・超難易度超絶超長いコンボ前提
　ストII系的な駆け引きなどを求めると無理がありすぎます。
　やる側としては面倒なだけですが、海外だと喜ばれるのでしょうか？

・プレステパッド前提すぎ
　ボタン割り振ってもアナログ左・右有り前提だったり、他のパッドだと操作がやりにくい。というかボタン数が足りないとセッティング終了できません。PCにはいろいろなパッドがあるという前提に立てていません。

対戦はやってませんので省略（相手も居ないでしょうし…）

基本は十分良いですが、細かいところが雑というか足りないのは、やはり海外製って感じですね。
しかしこれだけ日本向けなゲームが日本で作られていないとは…日本のゲーム制作も落ちてしまったものですなぁ。

review:
This game is super fun. Unique characters, spectacularly detailed sprite graphics, beautiful backgrounds, great music. There's a lot of charm in the characters and the backgrounds. You can make your control anime style or Street Fighter style and choose your specials. The move list is always at the side. This game did a lot right, I love it. If you have a friend or two to play it with, I recommend it.

If you're looking for a fighter to get serious into, this would be a cool one but it's completely devoid of players. There's interesting mechanics with meter, and combos are fun, but there's no one to play with. Also once you reach a certain level you basically play around meter rather than health. One touch from someone with full meter is gonna be 70% + of your HP.

author: {'steamid': '76561198140342396', 'num_games_owned': 174, 'num_reviews': 68, 'playtime_forever': 4745, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 731, 'last_played': 1631817935}
review:
Depends on 3rd party software to run. This would qualify it for no reccomendation already but when the game is working, it's mediocre at best. The translation was just ripped from the Hong Kong localization (so expect engrish text wherever humanly applicable) The online is a wasteland at this point, so don't bother if you're in it for that. The singleplayer is pretty mediocre, and the arcade / story mode is brought down not only by the aformentioned engrish, but also some embarrassing endings. You see that 5th picture in the gallary? Imagine that but for every female character, being explained away by something very along the lines of "oh, well I guess the battle is over now, ho hum what should I do now? Disrobing sounds like a good idea--". I'll add that even for a japanese fighting games, most of the female character designs are pretty shameless in their obvious intent (my personal favorite is either the essential equivelent of the daughter of c'thulu having a permanant wedgie or the cyborg ninja having her nipples protrude through metal armor). The customization options are kind of cool on the surface, but you have to unlock colors, and you're only allowed a certain number of them. You're better off referring to Blazblue Central Fiction's modding community if you have a hard on for that sort of thing. The customization for the fights are a pretty okay idea, but the execution is underwhelming, and not as well balanced as one would hope. As for character balance, it's not the absolute worst, but if there were to be an online scene, you'd probably come to expect the three characters with easy to access "technically not touch of deaths, but may as well be since they also corner carry and end with hard knockdown into 50/50". It's alright with friends, but frankly there are just other fighting games which do what this game does but cheaper and / or better. 

3/10 This is definitely a pass, but if its ever on sale, get it under the assumption that you'll probably have to refund immediately it if you don't have the aformentioned 3rd party tech.

author: {'steamid': '76561198126675373', 'num_games_owned': 916, 'num_reviews': 48, 'playtime_forever': 95, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 95, 'last_played': 1525050230}
review:
[i]Si vous me connaissez, j'adore les jeux de baston. Pourquoi ?
Le skill. Ne vous méprenez pas, je suis diablement mauvais, mais j'aime que peut importe si vous avez joué 5h ou 50h, c'est le skill qui parle. On commence pareil, avec la meme main : Il n'y a pas une frontier de niveau infranchissable comme un rpg.
Autant dire que je suis tres preneur de se style, et quand un jeu me decois, c'est qu'il y va fort.[/i]

[h1]Un test pour [url=https://store.steampowered.com/curator/29728880-Les-Actionnaires-de-La-Tentakhul/]"Les Actionnaires de la Tentkhul"[/url], pour un jeu que je doit déconseiller...[/h1]

[u]C'est un des quatre "petits" jeux de baston steam édité par Arc S.W.[/u], avec [Url=https://store.steampowered.com/app/661990/Arcana_Heart_3_LOVEMAX_SIXSTARS/]Arcana Heart[/url], dans le meme genre, mais avec l'originalité de "combiner" des persos, [Url=https://store.steampowered.com/app/411370/Melty_Blood_Actress_Again_Current_Code/]Melty Blood[/url], avec ses trois styles de combat pour chaque perso, et son concept pour l'histoire et les personnages, et [Url=https://store.steampowered.com/app/452510/UNDER_NIGHT_INBIRTH_ExeLate/]UnderNight[/url], avec son accessibilité et sa technicité, comme dragon ball fighter Z mais en bien.

En vrai, allez sur n'importe lequel de ces jeux, c'est largement plus intèressant.

[b]Parsque Chaos Code, qu'est-ce que c'est ?[/b]

C'est une sorte d'hommage a la vieille époque du jeux de baston...
Je ne dit pas bonne vieille, parsque je suis désolé pour les puristes, mais les jeux actuels sont bons si ce n'est meilleur, en plus d'éviter de devoir vendre un rein pour finir une arcade sur une borne.

Parlons du jeu :

[b]L'histoire c'est...
Et bien... 
Il se trouve...[/b]
Non mais sérieusement, je vais etre honnete, je parle mal anglais, mais je sais un peu pret lire ! Et j'ai compris l'histoire des jeux précédament cité, mais ici, je ne peut rien vous dire... J'ai fais quelque arcade sans trouver de fil rouge...

"Mais Jonathan, on s'en fout de l'histoire !".
NON.
J'en ai ma claque d'entendre cela. Certe, c'est le gameplay le plus important, mais il me faut un trucs ! Quelque chose qui me donne de la hype, et me rapproche du perso que je joue !

[b]Parsque les perso, le jour ou le charisme à été distribué, le jeu manquait à l'appel...[/b]

C'est d'un Lambda !!! Si l'on exept "Catherine" qui est mille fois trop stylé pour ce jeu, le perso comme ses coups, et Kagari, avec certe un design classique mais tres réussis, en mode "prenez-moi pour Blazblue Cross Battle", le reste...
Entre la Cammy de service qu'est Lupinus, la touche de Fantasy raté qu'est Bravo ou Cait&Sith, le barbant des perso tellement lassant, sutout avec le manque de developpement, Cerberus, Hikarugi ou Vein, les méchant nuls come Kudlar, qui fait frémir les midinette, et Celia II, rolala je suis maléfique... J'ai rien a dire sur les restants, tellement il ne m'on pas marqué...

Ils y a un mode pour personnaliser les couleurs des persos, comme... Autre chose.
Et bon point, car meme si la cohérence graphique n'est qu'en vague concept pour ce jeu, les dessin de coté pour combler le 3/4 sont plutot beau et efficasse...
C'est une coincidence le 3/4 parsque justement... non oublier....

Les arènes sont plutot quelquonque... Y'a des fois de l'animation... C'est pas trop mal... Mouais.... Et les musiques, qui sont sympa, mais sans plus...
Ca me rappelle... Autre chose.

[B]Et le systeme de combat...

Ne croyer pas la richesse sois disant incroyable des coups... On pick notre perso, et vous allez vous dire : OUA ! On chosis deux capacités suplémentaire sur quatre !...[/b]
Perso je vois juste qu'on sauve deux capacité pendant qu'on nous sucres les deux autres... Mais sur se coup je suis mauvais langue... 
Et j'ai joué a Melty Blood, donc ça a coté... Bof Bof...
Et on choisis aussi si l'on veux courir ou dash... Ben j'ai jouer a Blazblue, pour un exemple connus... C'est pas foufou... c'est bien fait, mais c'est pas transandant...

Et je pourrais peut en profiter si l'ia savait utiliser une garde ! Ben sang se codage !... Et non, je suis désolé, mais que l'IA garde ou attaque a la releve, c'est la base. Ici vous allez pouvoir tranquillement infiniser dans un coin, a la limite l'avant boss commence a se défendre...

[u]Et en parlant de ça : Le mode arcade de la tristesse infinit...[/u]
Un petit texte en entrée... Pas de chalengers... Pas de dialogue personnalisé pour chaque ennemie (petit roster je vous rappelle), meme pas d'ecran pour les super ou ultra finish... les deux boss sont montré par une image fixe, pas de doublage... et la fin pareille, 3 images pour la conclusion, pas de doublage...
Youpis...

Bon sang... C'est Retro, mais en mal.
Les gars, je veux viens qu'on fasse des jeux à l'ancienne, je veux bien qu'on fasse dans le minimalisme... Mais Voila [URL=https://store.steampowered.com/app/222420/THE_KING_OF_FIGHTERS_98_ULTIMATE_MATCH_FINAL_EDITION/]KOF, cliquer... allez y.[/Url]
Mais bord... de plage, dans Kof, y'avais des perso stylé ! Des arènes dynamique ! De la bonne zic ! 
Vraiment on dirait là un hommage aux racines, mais feignant...[/b]

author: {'steamid': '76561197971316390', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 97, 'playtime_forever': 100, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 100, 'last_played': 1514980081}
review:
Retro is a funny thing. When something is deliberately retro then it is seen as a feature. You can often see this with titles that use pixel-art intentionally to capture the nostalia of the early-80s gaming and many people love the game all the more for that fact. But when a game isn't trying to do that it looks and feels dated. That is Chaos Code.

When you look at the videos and such things are moving at such a blistering speed due to the skill of the players it all looks fantastic but when you sit down with the title and actually play it the jerky animations and lacklustre character resolution make it seem like you've loaded up an arcade title on MAME from the 90s. We're talking about graphics that are only a shade better than something like Marvel vs Capcom 2. The game's general presentation is also poor, it looks and feels rushed with spelling mistakes due to translation issues, menus that don't quite fit on the screen and stupid oversights like the inability to preview which color-switch you've selected from the character screen or the option to cancel your character choice and go back a step.  On the audio front the sound quality is... varied. Some of the voice samples sound like someone was far too close to the microphone, while others appear fine but with Ray his voice lines actually sound like they were being played back from a VHS tape from the 80s due to the audio quality. The music is hit and miss with some very fitting tunes but none are especially memorable.

But enough of the aesthethics, how does it play?

Frankly, the inputs are somewhat unforgiving. After playing many hours of SF4 you get to realise that Capcom give you very narrow windows of delay to complete specials simply to make the game more accessible. Looking back over the years you can see how this has developed because I remember days when I would struggle to perform Akuma's Shun Goku Satsu super move and now I can do it far more reliably in SF4. Chaos Code doesn't really do that as you soon discover that attempting many of the air-specials or air-super specials is very hit and miss. You can only really pull them off if you've chained them into a ground-special that will allow for an air-juggle since the animations give you a little more time to rotate the movement stick. In terms of the technical side, far too many characters play very similiar to each other and projectiles are very very common which really devalues the experience in my opinion since you spend much of your time trying to close the gap with the opponent if they are spamming them. The game leans heavily on specials as the varity of normals is simply not there. Many fighting games these days have different normals when moving forwards, jumping straight up, jumping forwards, crouching and standing still but Chaos Code generally has only normals for standing, couching and jumping. Some characters do have advancing normals but this is specific to them only. Some players may find that fine but frankly I'm not keen on leaning on specials to counter an opponents movement because there isn't a normal available due to a reduced repertoire that has become standardized in many other games from this genre.

On the plus side, the game has a wonderful sense of humor with many characters although this is not consistant across the all so its hard to really say if the developers were trying to be light-hearted with the tone of the game or not. It does suffer from a bit of an identity crisis as a result. The specials themselves are also very easy to remember due to many being half or quarter circles which is great of you like to vary which characters you use.

All in all, this is not something I can recommend though due to the negatives far out-weighing the positives. There are far better examples of 2D fighting games around that don't feel like you've booted up an arcade emulator and run a ROM from the 90s. As much as I love the concept of Chaos Code the way the game is presented is simply poor from both the visual and audio aspects; plus the underlying mechanics are not up the usual standard of quality you expect from the genre these days.

author: {'steamid': '76561198274296955', 'num_games_owned': 315, 'num_reviews': 92, 'playtime_forever': 761, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 255, 'last_played': 1704661775}
review:
ARC System comes back with another great fighting game! And man, it is so much fun! With its easy-to-learn mechanics and smooth combos and graphics, we have to take a look at this game! Released in 2016 for PC and PS4, Chaos Code can easily be described as the simplest ARC System game, and we are going to figure out why.

Gameplay: This game is a 4 button fighter similar to SNK's King of Fighters series. It works in it's favor too, as it has the 2 punches and kicks. Of course, we also have specials, and like Street Fighter 3, pressing multiple punches or kicks will allow for an EX version doing more damage. Supers are also in and are self explanatory with level 3s. It is so fun and addicting on itself, but there is more: certain characters like the smol Rui allows you to do air combos. Speaking of characters, when you pick one, you are given 4 options, 2 new specials, and the other 2 are reversal counter moves. You are also given the option to choose run or a SF3 style dash jump. You can also do ARC styled super jumps, double jumps, and air dashes, but you cannot do multiple jump styles. Now of course, we get the usual modes, arcade, survival, online, and the ARC System staple: score attack.They mostly work well, and I do have some issues, but we will get there later.

Graphics: This game uses hand drawn anime graphics with some pixel style art. The combination works better than you may think. This causes a smooth gameplay style where you know what you are doing. I barely have any issues, if at all! Even at max graphics on my dirt powered computer, the game runs at a smooth 60FPS with no noticeable frame drops or slowdown. The stages present are also cool with a good variety, but they don't really have too much animation, but that is fine, it does not take down my enjoyment of the game.

Sound and Music: The game's OST is well made, but isn't really memorable. This is an issue with plenty of fighting games. Capcom are the main guys who make great fighting game OSTs, so they should be hired. The sounds themselves are not too bad, and they fit. Attacks sound great with some good voices, but one character does have a really annoying sound when hit.

Replayablility: Fighting games always do well here with the combos you can learn, character styles, and so much more. I won't go into detail here as I'll just repeat what I said in my Skullgirls review.

Extra notes: Here we go. The survival and score attack modes are broken. What I mean is that they do not follow your options, meaning you MUST only have one round and MUST have them at rising difficulty, and it rises fast and hard! It gets to BS levels of hard and definitely frustrating. Online mode, well, nobody plays online. No joke. It's impossible to find a game unless it's with a friend.

Final verdict: So many good things and only a few bad things. You can predict my final thoughts. Now, obviously, you might disagree with me, and that is fine, opinions. However, based on my experiences and playtime, I can say that I can give this game an 8/10 with a Rui doll. It is so good that you have to play it to know. If it was not for Maximilian Dood, I would have never heard of this game... maybe. But still, I thank him. Since the game is only about 20 bucks, you are not losing much, so I highly recommend it.
Also, Rui is just, so cute! I know I say that about a lot of female characters, especially in anime inspired games, but how can I resist?

author: {'steamid': '76561198031899854', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 1591, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1103, 'last_played': 1711200079}
review:
short version
- netcode
+ everything else
A very interesting and fun game, but be sure to have some friends closeby with stable connections to play with.

long version
This game use delay based netcode. Having underwater matches when your ping is too big is to be expected. But this game netcode has some serious problems elsewhere: dealing with -unstable- ping. It will desyncs for very little ping variation, and in a good case it detects the desync and terminate the match. In a bad case, it will freeze the game and you will have to close the program and reopen it.

With this said, this game is still awesome.
The ost is brilliant, going from jazz funk "no forgiveness" by Mint Jam, classic music like "sonata for celia" by Kou, the more techno-ish funk "Rumble" by nekono, and the full blown out techno "Cut N' Run" by -45. Just for the number of different composers and how well know some of them are (like Mint Jam), it's obvious how much care was put on the ost.

The gameplay have a mix of elements from different games that might please lot's of different people. It have airblock and the option after using a jump to do a doublejump or airdash (not both), that gives the spacing a ASW feel. Your 2D/cr.HK usually is the normal with more range but cant be canceled into special moves (that gives a street fighters 3 and onward feel). Jumping during a dash will trigger a super jump automatically and you can cancel special moves into supers by expending a extra bar (later kof's elements).

But there are lot's of original elements in the mix that gives the game it's own flavor. You can "customize" your character by choosing 2 between 2 extra special moves and 2 extra supers. And separate from that, you can choose between run style dash and step style dash. It might sounds like something from kof98umfe, but it's different. By choosing step dash, your walk speed don't increase, but your meter gain will. Also, it have a little of invul in the legs and you can cancel close normals into step dash, making it the way to go for tick throws. On the other side, the run have faster activation and recovery speed, so you can move more safely and microdash to convert into a combo from more situations.

review:
Juegazo de peleas al mas puro estilo 2d , recordando en algunos aspectos a juegos como Rage Of The Dragons y con mucho contenido offline , algo que escasea cada vez mas.
Desgraciadamente no es una franquicia muy conocida y su online , aunque activo , esta bastante abandonado.
Los graficos son de antaño , no espereis un Guilty Gear , Kof XIII o similar.... pero cumplen perfectamente y a mi particularmente me gustan bastante ya que me recuerda a los viejos tiempos de la Neogeo , Cps1 , Cps2 , etc....
El aspecto jugable es bastante bueno , tenemos varias mecanicas ya conocidas por varios titulos de lucha , cancels , especiales , movimientos Ex , etc.... y lo mejor es que desde el primer toque se acomoda uno muy bien a ello.
El juego goza de una IA bastante decente , un modo arcade (si si xDD) con 2 finales distintos por personaje (hay juegos actuales que no tienen ni uno...) , 2 jefes finales (ya vienen desbloqueados en esta edicion) , modo survival , vs , practica , misiones (hay de las normalitas y las especiales no aptas para cardiacos xDD) , modo score , online (player match y ranked) editor de colores y modo coleccion donde desbloquearemos contenido adiccional como colores EX , personajes en versiones alternativas , ilustraciones , nuevas opciones , secretos , etc.....

En definitiva un juego con bastante contenido offline (como los de antes) y con posibilidad de online lastrado por la poca fama de la franquicia y la "moda" de solamente jugar hoy en dia a los 3 o 4 titulos de lucha conocidos.........

Lo recomiendo a todo aquel que le importe un pimiento las modas del online , Esports , etc.....un juego completo sin dlc , contenido abundante offline y muy buena jugabilidad.

author: {'steamid': '76561198268515191', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 1633, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1129, 'last_played': 1501252445}
review:
以前ゲーセンでちょこっと触っただけだったので家でプレイしてみようと購入。
おおまかなゲームのイメージはコンボゲー、ついでに火力高めで3ゲージ溜まったら体力8割以上飛ぶのは当たり前の環境。

・ゲームシステム
投げ以外に無敵の前転、発生1Fの打撃へのカウンターシステムのタクティカルガード、
ガードを割るガードブレイク、必殺技から超必殺技へのスパキャン等々基本的なものは揃ってる感じ。
後は3ゲージ使って一定時間超必殺技使い放題のエクシードカオスを使えば最初に書いた8割以上の火力が出たりします。
また、各キャラ選択時に4つある追加技から2つを選ぶ事が出来て、前方向2回入力で出るのがランかステップかも選択できるので、それにより同キャラでも多少の差異が出たりします。

気になった点は典型的なコンボゲーだと地上通常技からレバー上に要れてジャンプキャンセルして空中コンボ移行みたいなのが多いけど、
このゲームは一瞬下にいれてから上いれてハイジャンプキャンセルでないと地上通常技キャンセル出来ない所ですかね。
慣れてないせいもあるでしょうが正直やり辛い。
もう一つ気になったのはレバーもボタンも先行入力めちゃくちゃ効いてるので波動が昇竜に化けたりが割とあります。
ただこっちはリバサで表裏対応の無敵昇竜の入力とか技の繋ぎを最速でやるのとかが凄い楽なので悪い事ばかりでもない。

・選べるモード
ストーリーモードやCPU戦、トレモと後はミッションなど昨今の格ゲーにあるものは大体あります。
後はミッションとかでお金貯めてカラーとかCG開放してくださいねっていう定番のもあります。
持ちキャラ決めたらまずはそのキャラのカラーパレットを最速で開放するのが良いんじゃないかな。
トレモにも必用な機能は大体揃ってますがキーディスがないっぽいのと、操作の記録が2P側というかcpu側にしか行えないのが若干不便かも。

・キャラクターやBGM
魅力的なキャラは揃ってると思います、貧乳巨乳に少年やおじ様、アンドロイドから神話生物的なサムシングまでばっちり。
またBGMについてもカオスコードが世に出た当初に言われてたクティーラBGMとか良いのもいくつかありました。

・ネット対戦
ほとんど対戦出来てないんでノーコメント、他のsteam格ゲーも割とそうだけど過疎なのが残念。

・総評
操作難易度的には初心者にはあまりオススメしないけどトレモにひたすら篭るのが好きなタイプなら楽しいかも。
格ゲー好きなら価格相応の価値はあると思います。
ルピナスちゃん可愛い。

CHAOS CODE: New Sign of Catastrophe it's a classic 2D fighting game, it does not revolutionize the fighting genre, but it leaves you with a very good impression (especially if you are an old school gamer that grew up with games like King of Fighters series) .
I think that this title was published before in PS3 and this time when doing the "jump" on PC they added the Online Mode. Unfortunately, the stability and interface is not the best and you will find lag or even wont be finding any matches (depending in your zone).
 
Even so, the game has many game modes that will keep you entertained, not to mention the great personality and style of movement of the characters.


::You will like::
- The 2D Art. 
- The characters roster -while short- it's awesome. 
- The fluidity of combat. A rare mix between KoF and Guilty Gear.
- Music suits the fighting quite well.
- The stages. I will not say that they are a "bomb", as they are as retro and classic as possible. But that's the charm right there.
- Many game modes to have fun and practice new moves.
- Price. Full controller support, Steam achives' and cards. The good extra stuff.

You're gonna hate:

author: {'steamid': '76561198054315189', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 1738, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1016, 'last_played': 1550331080}
review:
Chaos Code is one hell of an underground game. The visuals feel very unattractive, the story and dialogues are exceptionally stupid, even among anime fighters. Voice acting is so damn cringeworthy that it becomes funny in the end. To top it all, there are typos all over the place - what the hell were the developers even doing? All in all, the first impression may be kinda unappealing. But what lies beneath the surface is a very enjoyable little fighting game.

There is a generous roster of characters with different playstyles and customizable moveset. Even though the visuals are ugly, the combat feels really smooth and responsive. The moves look cool and combos are satisfying. I fell in love with the stages, which are very often lively, colorful and funny. The background music is top-notch (really, Cthylla's stage BGM is just lovely) and the ending CGs are beautiful. There is also a lot of single-player content to enjoy, in case you don't have friends to play with or don't know about Discord.

While Chaos Code certainly isn't an A-tier fighting game (like GG, BB, Uniel and so on), I still think it would be a mistake to just dismiss it. I'm having a blast with the game at this moment and I think I will be coming for more in the near future.

author: {'steamid': '76561197979892262', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 29, 'playtime_forever': 32, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 32, 'last_played': 1489948514}
review:
I love anime style fighting games... but I felt this one was just sub-par. The moves didnt feel impactful, the characters felt bland.. and I hated their idea of 'custom color', where instead of being able to pick whatever color you desire for a certain part, instead it was overly simplified with preselected colors, which most you had to unlock. The combat felt bland, and I do not like that there was no option for at least english subtitles. I have no idea which characters have a story with who, and the arcade playthrough for a story... It felt like the ending I witnessed was written by a 10 year old. the dialogue just felt so... immature, for lack of better words.

Now the combat, while bland, is still playable. I just say this because I feel that I have been spoiled by Guilty Gear and Blazblue in terms of speed of combat and graphical style. the game isnt -TOO- bad... but I just unfortuantely could not find my bearings in this one, nor do I feel I could bother to continue playing after beating the game once with just one character.  For any major fans of something like Guilty Gear or Blazblue, I'd recommend you stay away from this one, but if you are just a nerd/major fan for anime fighters in general... there should be -something- here for you to enjoy. I will admit, I loved the music in this one and the backgrounds were still entertaining to see, but the characters i saw just looked... stereotypical in terms of anime fighters. Most felt cookie-cutter, in terms of they felt like characters from old snk fighting games like King of Fighters.

All that being said, I just cant bring myself to truly recommend this game. As stated, if you are fan of much faster combat in terms of fighting games, you might want to avoid this one, but if you are a major fan of any and all anime fighters you are sure to find something to enjoy with this.

author: {'steamid': '76561198306295240', 'num_games_owned': 50, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 108, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 29, 'last_played': 1493188683}
review:

但是，应该看到，毕竟这是台湾自己研发的2D格斗，几百张手绘帧确实麻烦，虽然它和ARC公司其他作品存在一些差距，甚至2D点绘水平还不如圣灵之心那时候，但是各位看看现在大陆的2D横板，你就会觉得这个已经很不错了，现在的大陆自己研发的2d游戏，绝大部分用的是2D骨骼动画（比如《ICEY》），懒得画手绘帧，也懒得尽力，而且走路的2D都做不好，就要跑步做3D，结果做出来的大部分都是些垃圾手游和低质量端游，我还是那个观点，2D像素游戏这一块，台湾是走在大中华区前列的，不管是上个世纪的《三国战纪》还是《西游释厄传》，还是今天的《混沌代码》，之前的年代，大陆没有拿得出手的一个标杆，至少我的童年没有垃圾《炫斗之王》。看看当年冒险岛和DNF在中国火爆的时候，那些的仿制品诸如《《快乐西游》《QQ三国》《名将三国》等就已经暴露了中国2D游戏的水平，像素模型做不好就做假3D，像个木偶人似的，至少学学KOF13吧，先3D建模，设计好动作，再蒙上转成2D点绘。
虽然一国两制，但是我还是愿意支持这个国产。就和当时买了ICEY一样

author: {'steamid': '76561198132360016', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 69, 'playtime_forever': 411, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 310, 'last_played': 1501622274}
review:
If you know about this game: it's not just 3:4, you can turn off these liners and play on widescreen. I don't know why there are no screenshots on the store page to show it.

Considering netcode: It's OK. If I'm to compare it with other titles using Steamworks, I would rate this game as 6\10, GG REVELATOR 10\10. BB:CP 8\10, Melty Blood as 1\10 and Nitroplus Blasterz as 3\10. Koihime Enbu is pretty much the same 6\10. I'm using my friend from Germany as a reference for this scale. While we have 2-3 frames delay in GG, "1" connection in BB:CP, he couldn't even connect me on this one upon invite. Nevertheless, I'm in the middle of somewhere, and connection is pretty much OK around me. Game retains it's responsiveness even on slowed-down matches, so you could ram and command grab your opponent with 632146k throw in real time. One "but" is that the game is re-syncronizing, it appears, in-between rounds. You know, that initial delay you're experiencing before the 1st round begins in most online-fightings. It occurs here between rounds, too, and took from 20 to 50 seconds for me.

Considering input: you can remap most of the keys on KB, ESC and Enter excluded, directionals included. The game works with my old Praetorian RF MT1501 (bought it in 2004), which means it works with pretty much any other DirectInput gamepad.


If you don't know about this game: input here is quite sophisticated. It follows the wide number of paterns for special attacks, close to what you could see in Skullgirls. Also, there are 7 universal techs with their 2 button (you can bind them in macroses) input.
For cell-animation this one is pretty good. Somehow, it looks more clunky on the store page's video than it actually is. Meanwhile, voicing is directly opposite. I'm sorry, but my ears are melting from it. I survived Continuum Shift's english dub before original japanese had arrived, but there is nothing to save me from this one. Yes, I've played other low-budget fightings. But some characters here is just unbearable. Yet again, sorry.

Overall, the more I play, the more I like this game :)

author: {'steamid': '76561198276383313', 'num_games_owned': 2410, 'num_reviews': 214, 'playtime_forever': 1685, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 530, 'last_played': 1490092450}
review:
オーストラリアのゲーム会社が製作した格ゲーだった様ですが、良くも悪くも
近年の日本のアニメやゲームのテイストが盛り込まれた、ちょっとした異色作でしたね。

ラン・ステップだけでなく、固定のそれらとはまた別な、必殺技とアルティメット
カオスを選択できるのが大きな特徴でした。まあプレイ回数が少ないうちは、
特に後者はあまりコマンドが難しくないのを選んだ方が無難だったかもでも
ありましたが、ある程度プレイヤーのスタンスにも自由に対応でき、なかなか斬新な
試みだったでしょう。

その他はEX必殺技や強化発動技、スーパーキャンセルと他の格ゲーでも見られたルール
が多かったですが、プレイヤーキャラは良くも悪くもアクが強い面々が多かった感じ
でしたね。特にセリアⅡ改は「無駄無駄」って、ジョジョのディオのパロディも
見られましたが、まあゲラゲラ笑えたほどでもなかったですかな?

CPU戦は近年の他の格ゲー同様難易度は比較的低めで、どのキャラを使用しても
ラスボスまで行くのは難しくは無かったです。そのラスボス、クドゥラック
は中二病な小者で、ラスボスとしては下の上から中の下程度の出来でしたが、
彼も飛び道具を持っているキャラの場合、比較的楽に倒せますね。飛び道具だけでも
ある程度以上ゴリ押し出来ます。近づかれたら何とかして追い払うしかないですが。

そのクドゥラックも人が使うと、一部シリーズの豪鬼みたいに体力を減らされてしまう
ハンデを課されてしまう様ですが、PCでも発売されている様なので、格ゲーだけでなく、
近年のアニメやゲーム等が好きな人は買ってみても損はしないでしょう。EDもなかなか
力が入ってますしね。評価は、ラスボスがもっとキャラ立っていたら「良い」以上に
なっていたと思います。

review:
Game's got tight gameplay and a good variety of moves. No 2 characters really play quite the same and it's moderate roster of characters allows for a more intimate style of fighting game. 

It's not the most visually appealing fighting game but it's far from ugly or unprofessional looking. 

The only thing Chaos Code ever really lacked was online and that's now been established. 

The only other foible I could attribute to this title was the commical amount of engrish that plagued the vanilla version and even that has been addressed in this update.

It's a fairly simple little anime dasher when all is said and done.  Tight controls.  Graphics, music, and plot that function as they should.  This isn't a masterpiece by any stretch of the imagination but it's a SOLID fighting game and at the end of the day, that's all you can really ask of such a title besides good character balance.

review:
Pretty great game that I'd recommend everyone get if you're into fighting games.  It has a unique group of playable oddballs that all play pretty different from each other ranging from buff macho chef to a crossdressing cosplaying mangaka, to magical girl Cthulhu and so on. Solid netcode and thus far after playing a good 10 people from various locations around the world I haven't gotten any lag.  Game feels really smooth, has some nice animations, and has a fantastic soundtrack that I've been listening to for years now.  The offline modes are standard fair as there is arcade, practice,  vs, survival, score attack, and mission mode.  Having a color edit mode is nice too

Plus having art done by Ban is always good ( ͡° ͜ʖ ͡°)
